title: Sigurdsson closes on Lukaku
text:
Sky Sports Power Rankings: Swansea's Gylfi Sigurdsson closes in on Romelu Lukaku By Adam Smith  26am Everton striker Romelu Lukaku has kept his place at the Power Rankings summit after his four-goal haul against Bournemouth earlier this month. 
However, the Belgian's lead at the top was cut drastically after failing to replicate that form during the Toffees' 0-0 draw at Middlesbrough on Saturday. 
Team-mates Ross Barkley (No 7, down five places), Seamus Coleman (No 14, down three places) and goalkeeper Joel Robles (No 15, down five places) remained in the top 20. 
Alfie Mawson (No 5, up 67) volleyed Swansea in front against champions Leicester before Gylfi Sigurdsson (No 2, up one place) assisted Martin Olsson to double the lead and claim a 2-0 win. 
Manchester United trio Zlatan Ibrahimovic (No 4, up 13 places), Henrikh Mkhitaryan (No 8, up 12 places) and Chris Smalling (No 9, up 15 places) all made the top 10 after United's 2-0 win over Watford on Saturday. Zlatan Ibrahimovic was disappointed not to score against Watford on Saturday 
Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez (No 3, up 63 places) is the only Gunner in the top 30 after scoring a controversial opening goal to break the deadlock against Hull and converting a last-minute penalty. 
Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus held his No 6 spot this week despite only playing 15 minutes before being substituted through injury during City's 2-0 win at Bournemouth on Monday. 
The Power Rankings methodology reflects a player's performance by awarding points to players for 32 different matchday stats. 
Below, we present this week's Power Rankings, your club's top points scorer and the accumulative season rankings. 
The Sky Sports Power Rankings will be updated every Tuesday during the season, so be sure to keep an eye on the big movers... Also See:
